overview:
For 2 plus decades Brad Nickel has been a technology strategist, marketer, and business development executive primarily targeting the B2B market and with a degree of specialization in the Small Office Home Office (SOHO) markets.

Throughout his career he has been an innovator and inventor of technologies and since 1996 has had a complete focus on web technologies.

Highlights: In 1997 he conceived of and his team developed the world’s first tabbed browser for Equitrac Corporation called EPIC. It was based upon Internet Explorer and also included an email tab and tracking capabilities for research and time and billing.

In 1999 his team developed the worlds first web-based small business Application Service Provider(ASP) which today would be call Software As a Service. The service was called Appsonline and was introduced by Interliant. Via his leadership the service grew to thousands of users in the first 2 years and used technologies from Lotus(QuickPlace) and Microsoft.

In 2001 as a survivor of the dotcom meltdown, he launched his very successful small business web marketing firm providing web development, SEO, and SEM services to clients across the United States.

In 2008 he joined Landry and Kling to help them convert their 27 year old Group Cruise business onto the web in an automated application model called Seasite.com to serve meeting planners, corporations, and leisure groups around the world.

To this day he continues to innovate with his own firm and consults to startups across the country on their technology and strategy.
